storyInfo: Ebenholz and Kreide begin to rehearse for the concert. Hibiscus is conducting her investigation all over the Afterglow, looking to find the truth of the Infected suddenly recovering.

attributes.content: Though I sent the both of you off at the selections, things have changed. You two are now the primary candidates for Morgen und Abend.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Things have changed? What do you mean?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: The two who were to perform Morgen und Abend cannot attend the concert now, which is why I had you two brought in.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Cannot attend... Did something happen with them?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: They went to a tavern yesterday afternoon to eat and drink their fill.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Normal enough, but something piddling made those two clowns pick a fight.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: So now, the flautist has a fractured arm, and worse still, the cellist somehow fell on his tailbone. He can't even sit, and there he is lying on his bed claiming he can play standing instead. Ridiculous!
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You seem shocked.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: This is honestly... beyond expectation.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Is it?
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: It only took the second day of selections for this to happen, if I'm frank. If this was anything more than a chance bar fight, then you would be the greatest suspect.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Would I?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: No—no, no, no, this has less than nothing to do with me.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: My desire is to move you through music, not rough up the innocent.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Fine enough for you to say.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: But you have the money to back Kreide. Paying to stir up trouble should be easy enough for you, shouldn't it?
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Herr Czerny, I can testify Ebenholz never did anything like that.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: You, testify? Did you glue your eyes to him for all of yesterday?
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: —I did.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: And why did you do that?
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Of course he didn't 'glue his eyes to me,' the two of us were just together, discussing how to change your mind.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Though we never came to any conclusion in the end.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Kreide, is that the truth?
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: It is.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: (Shakes head)
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: For the time being, in the moment being, I'll believe Kreide.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Thank you, Herr Czerny!
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: So...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Don't start parading.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: All told, you're standing in. You're still some way from what I require.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Especially you, Ebenholz. You're the drag.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: I'll give you the one day to rehearse. Come back to my home this evening, and I'll cast my eye.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: You will only be chosen if you can meet my minimum standards. Otherwise, I would rather strike Morgen und Abend from the program. Understand?
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Yes. You may rest assured.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Also, Kreide, weren't you missing a cello? Take this one with you.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Ca... Can I really?
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Of course you can.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: If you can meet my demands this evening, then this cello will be yours.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: —Thank you, so, so much!
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Alright, off you go. I need to sort out my own thoughts as is—
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Is that Ursula? Did you forget your key again?
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Mr. Czerny, I'm an operator from Rhodes Island. You can call me Hibiscus.
attributes.name: Voice Outside the Door

attributes.content: Hibiscus! Oh, no, did something happen with my grandpa—
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Hello, Mr. Czerny, it's nice to meet you.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Hello.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: My talk with them is done. If you have business, feel free to take them away.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Hibiscus, is there anything new with my grandpa's condition?
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Relax, it's okay. Your grandpa's gotten treatment already, and he's looking a lot more stable.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Mr. Czerny, it's not Kreide. I actually came here looking for you.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Me?
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: I'm hoping to get some insight into any change in your condition. Would right now be convenient for you?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: What do you want me for?
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: There's been quite a few recent Infected cases of abnormal recovery around the Afterglow. I came here to investigate the whole phenomenon.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: On top of that, you're a household name around here, so I was wondering if you had more of a handle on what's going on.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: I'm sorry, but I've been just fine all along, and I can't say I know how anyone else is doing.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: But aren't you holding a farewell concert? That usually—
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: I'm—sorry—but I need quiet. Can I ask you to leave, for now?
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Who is it this time?
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Mein Herr, open her up. I forgot m'dang key.
attributes.name: Voice Outside the Door

attributes.content: Kreide, could you go out of your way to open the door again?
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: That's an awful lot you're carrying, Oma.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Good boy, you go have a seat. I can carry it by m'self.
It's okay, I can bring this into the kitchen for you!
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: And this is...?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Ursula, distant relative of mine. She's cared for me, always.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Well, this is a rare sight, so many people at our home...
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: Bowl me over, you're a noble, aren't you? Oh, m'pologies!
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: Hardly. You can simply call me Ebenholz, if you so wish.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Oh, your Lordy sort better not joke around with old codgers like m'self.
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: It's no joke at all. You can just call me Ebenholz.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Honest?
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: Of course.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Then if you don't mind me, please.
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: Hello, Ms. Ursula!
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Oof, what's this Sarka—
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: Bah, no! Slip of the tongue, Fräulein, I didn't mean that. Don't take it seriously, now!
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: It's okay, Ms. Ursula, I'm used to it.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Oh, no, no, I have to apologize... really, pardon me!
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: What do you need Mein Herr for? Concert matters again?
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: Not in particular. I wanted to ask if there was any change in Mr. Czerny's condition recently.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: You a doctor?
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: I'm an operator from Rhodes Island. You can call me Hibiscus.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: So you and Andante are coworkers?
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: Andante's a local operator. I'm here at Vyseheim on business from the landship.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: That's a relief, then.
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: It's Andante who gives Mein Herr and me our medicine. Lots of folk get prescriptions from Rhodes Island, here in the Afterglow.
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: Mein Herr, how's the last few days...
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: Ahem.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Mein Herr, she's a doctor, now, a doctor who cares about your health. This is good for you.
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: I didn't ask her to come in!
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Well, that's silly, now. If you didn't let her in, she wouldn't be in here.
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: Last year's when he started feeling unwell. No change when spring came this year. Wouldn't be wanting to do any farewell concert otherwise.
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: But since yesterday, he's been looking in much better spirits.
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: Is there anything else as well?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Let me think...
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: Ursula!
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Alright, alright, m'lips are sealed.
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: Thank you so much for your help, Ms. Ursula.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: If anything's the matter with Mr. Czerny, please give me a shout.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: No need to tell us. We'd be asking Rhodes Island for a look if something happened, anyway.
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: Are you done? Are you happy?
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: All done—
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: —Oh, me and my memory! Said I'd make potato soup and forgot to even buy potatoes... I'll run back to the market now!
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: Mr. Czerny...
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: (Eyes practically full of fire)
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: —Ms. Ursula, I'll come with you! I have some questions about cooking I'd like to ask you!
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Well, since everyone else has taken their leave, we should also...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Hold it.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Herr Czerny...
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: The key.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Oma Ursula, your key! Don't forget your key!
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Huff, huff...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I never would've imagined an old lady could be so fast. I was a hair from losing her...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I owe it to you for helping me smooth things over back there.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: That's alright, I trust in you. I know you wouldn't do something like that just to be selected.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: So, we've handed the key over. Now we should be finding a place in the Afterglow to rehearse.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Can't we just perform right in the street, like everyone does?
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: We're rehearsing, not busking. These lanes are too noisy.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Oh.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: How about your home? Your grandfather just so happens to have vacated, and it wears me to death traveling over from the Cliffy Patio every day.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Could I ask you to lay out a bed for me, and I stay at yours for the next while?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I'd welcome you, gladly, but my place is a wreck. I'm scared you wouldn't settle in.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: I will, I will. Trust me.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: This is my home.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Ergk...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: What's the matter?
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Is there something wrong...?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: (The room's too small, there's a draft from the window, the timber is molding, there's practically no soundproofing...)
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: No, It's quite fine. Quite fine.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: —Hold on, there's only a single bed here. Where does your grandpa sleep?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: He sleeps in the bed. I sleep here on the floor.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: But... isn't this just a rug?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: For a rug, it's pretty nice, and I'm used to sleeping on it by now.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: If you're going to live here, then I'll stay on the floor. It's no problem.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Let's just rehearse for now.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: No good. I'm stuck at this mordent.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: It's alright. We can start again from the last bar on the line above.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: It's this mordent...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Should I slow down slightly at this part?
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: No need, it's only an ornament. I'm just being slightly hesitant.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: —This again!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Ebenholz, I'll drop the tempo. Don't put an ornament at the end there, just play through like it's a single note.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: The mark is printed on the score!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: But you're straining your breath all the way in the bar before, just so you can brace for the mordent.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Fine.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Wonderful! We played it all the way through!
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: But I omitted that ornament, and Czerny will hear that, I'm sure of it.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: It's alright, we still have time.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Easily said. With the state we're in now, you've no need for further rehearsal. I'm the only one who still has to spend time on this.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: No, don't be like that. I have parts I'm not playing well myself.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Really?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Look, here. I didn't express these dynamics at all just now.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: You're right.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: And there's a few parts I've been barely forcing through. It's still too early to say I'm fluent.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: You gave me a heart attack. I thought you'd already completely mastered this.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Haha. We've had so little time, and it's not like you could really be fluent in a single go. You have to take a lot of things nice and slow.
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: You're right.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Let's take a break for now, and then we'll work out all the kinks.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: O'er lofty Hills, the Fiend steps into Twilight's Midst agaze.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: The Blood hides Plague within, slow beckons Death to creep all Ways.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Pestilence from Shadow wanton spouts, spews Ruin in Prelude.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Fades Finale's Ensemble; Woe deprives of Sun's last Rays.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: What do you think of these edits?
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: It's more or less the same as the previous edition. You're sure this prophecy will drive out the Rhodes Islander?

A prophecy alone likely isn't enough, but if we add Their Majesties' names, then use it as a pretext to cause a tiny little uproar... the chance it'll succeed is great, and there won't be any real harm should it fail.
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Can you ensure the spread of this prophecy will be confined to the Afterglow?
Please be assured. Previous small-scale disseminations of prophecies have not left any traces of their spread; moreover, as an Infected settlement—
attributes.name: Gertrude

attributes.content: Then do it.
